column1: Pres. Trump's refusal to concede and allow a transition harms every American. It hampers national security efforts our fight against #COVID19 and more.  Since Pres. Trump won't accept the truth my GOP colleagues need to publicly make it clear: Joe Biden is President-Elect.

It's unreal that @senatemajldr is wasting precious time confirming more Trump judges while Americans suffer from a growing #COVID19 threat. The House passed additional relief months ago & the Senate needs to make this priority #1. Congress works for Americans not the President.

COVID-19 continues to ravage our state our nation and the entire world. I know this has been a tough year and we're all tired. But we can't let up our fight against this virus. In fact as cases rise to record levels we must fight harder than ever. Stay strong! #WearAMask!

Pfizer's announcement of a major breakthrough in its development of a #COVID19 vaccine is great news. But as President-Elect Biden said today we're still in for a very tough time ahead. Before & even after a vaccine is distributed we all need to do our part to slow the spread.

Small businesses are the backbone of our economy and as #COVID19 cases surge to record levels it’s clear they need our help more than ever. That's why I've introduced a bill to provide them an extension on the debt relief received through the #CARESAct. https://t.co/vZe3bH3iuZ

Indiana has just hit its highest number of #COVID19 cases ever. Hoosiers are hurting and need help. The House responded months ago by passing the #HeroesAct which provides trillions more towards fighting the pandemic. What is @senatemajldr waiting for? Pass this bill ASAP! https://t.co/yH8XO6raUs

Due to the #COVID19 pandemic @CDCgov has issued a moratorium on evictions for many Americans. The city of Indianapolis has created an online tool to find out if you qualify. Please be sure to utilize this important resource! https://t.co/arzY0TfV0b

#COVID19 has made it clearer than ever that everyone needs reliable high-speed broadband. Today the #TrumpFCC doubled down on repealing #NetNeutrality. If you agree that internet access should be a right not a privilege join us in fighting to restore a free and open internet. https://t.co/KV7KNrAz7h

When #COVID19 first hit our country Trump described himself as a wartime President. Now his Administration is waving the flag of defeat.  They’re surrendering when it’s more important than ever to keep fighting. https://t.co/PC2YQWpG4f
Hoosiers — #COVID19 cases are up in our state and we’ve got to stay vigilant. Wear a mask. Be smart. Take care of yourselves and others. Together we can beat this virus.

The ongoing #COVID19 crisis has highlighted students' need for great teachers and inspiring mentors to help get them through these tough times and beyond. I've introduced two pieces of legislation that help meet this need. Read more here: https://t.co/6Go8SsYCMc

Attention! @IRSNews is holding a live webinar tomorrow October 9th to help Hoosiers receive their #COVID19 Economic Impact Payment who haven't already. Don't miss this helpful and free opportunity! Register here: https://t.co/N7PceJf65c

Pres. Trump claims that Americans shouldn’t live in fear of #COVID19.    What he doesn’t realize is that taking steps to protect ourselves & loved ones from the virus isn’t cowardly. It’s smart.   The only thing we (rightfully) fear is his disastrous response to this pandemic.
I'm praying for President Trump the First Lady and everyone who is battling #COVID19. This virus is extremely serious and we are all at risk. Please please be safe and take care of yourselves.

I was honored to preside over the House of Representatives tonight as we passed an updated version of the #HeroesAct. This $2.2 trillion dollar relief bill strengthens our fight against COVID-19 and its economic devastation. I urge the Senate to pass it immediately.

This new version of the #HeroesAct is estimated to provide Indianapolis with more than $293 million in funds to help fight #COVID19 protect our workers strengthen our local economy and much more. I will proudly vote YES and urge my Republican colleagues to do the same. https://t.co/pThwjgLRuu

The #COVID19 crisis has proven how essential Hoosier small businesses are to our community. Four months ago the House voted to provide them more relief by passing the #HeroesAct. The Senate needs to also pass this vital legislation immediately. #SmallBusinessWeek

Today I spoke on the House floor to honor the 200000 Americans we have lost to #COVID19. We can’t bring them back but we can prevent future loss of life by passing the #HeroesAct immediately. https://t.co/VoTthWSP1c

Their anti-science attitude and disdain for science hurts our fight against COVID-19. Please work with us to pass a relief bill that saves lives  and jobs. Time is running out and we can't waste another moment.

Experts say COVID-19 cases hospitalizations and deaths could get significantly worse this fall and winter. We need to pass a relief plan that helps prepare our country for the tough months ahead. The House has taken action by passing the #HeroesAct -- our boldest effort yet.

I want to work with Republicans on another #COVID19 relief package but they aren't facing reality. They're taking cues from a President who thinks the pandemic is behind us and the economy has bounced back. As a result their proposals are insufficient and don't meet the moment.

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! Our nation is experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/6IXCDg3n1y

#COVID19 relief efforts coming from President Trump and GOP Senate leaders are too little too late. We need to pass the #HeroesAct to get Hoosiers the help they need and deserve during this crisis.  https://t.co/vK7Bb8sclR

Rent is due and many families don't know how they're going to make payments amid #COVID19. The Senate's failure to act means millions could soon lose their homes. The eviction moratorium must be extended plus urgently needed rent relief. #StopEvictions #RentReliefNow

The @SenateGOP #COVID19 relief plan is too little too late. It rejects science slashes unemployment benefits and doesn't do enough for frontline workers. The House passed the #HeroesAct months ago. I urge my GOP colleagues to support this bolder better plan for Americans.

Good news! The city of Indianapolis has awarded $2.7 million dollars in Emergency Services Grants from the #CARESAct to several organizations helping Hoosiers who are experiencing homelessness. As we continue to struggle through #COVID19 this will be a big help to many.

1) This economic free fall could have been prevented had the Trump Admin. taken the #COVID19 threat seriously from the start.   2) We can prevent future damage by passing the #HeroesAct which strengthens our fight against the virus and helps protect millions from financial ruin. https://t.co/EJSBWk9W0q

#COVID19 has exacerbated racial and gender inequality and it will only get worse if we don't take action. That's why we must enact national paid leave for all workers ASAP. I'm laying out the case in the @indystar. https://t.co/HJ3OYyUEBm

I joined my colleagues in sending this letter. It is absolutely unacceptable that the Trump Administration is trying to censor public health information in the middle of a pandemic. We'll beat #COVID19 by relying on facts and data not suppressing them. https://t.co/zwpJ18ZyL0

This is a senseless & reckless decision that will surely cost lives by undermining the global fight against #COVID19.   America should lead this effort. Instead we lead the world in infections & deaths    We have to change course & rejoin the global effort to stop this pandemic. https://t.co/1g3SAm8DOX

BIG NEWS: @EskenaziHealth received over $38 million in funds from @HHSGov to help it continue leading the fight against #COVID19. I was honored to join w/ @RepVisclosky to secure this investment & will keep working to build up our public health system as we combat this pandemic.
Even in the middle of the #COVID19 pandemic President Trump is still trying to destroy the #AffordableCareAct which would rip health care coverage from millions of Americans.    Not on our watch.

#COVID19 Economic Impact Payments generally belong to recipients not their nursing homes and long-term care facilities. Be sure to let your friends and loved ones know and visit https://t.co/WqP7uWSFxl to stay informed. https://t.co/QFmZoGgydh

I’m sending my deepest sympathies to my good friend and colleague @Ilhan upon the loss of her father from complications from COVID-19. I know how much he meant to you and I know you will continue to make him proud.

I'm honored to introduce the COVID-19 Memorial Quilt Act of 2020 (H.R. 7161). Inspired by the NAMES Project AIDS Memorial Quilt this bill will help give people across America the opportunity to properly honor loved ones lost to this horrible virus. https://t.co/7HhakurwRI

Today’s @TransportDems hearing on COVID-19's impacts on transportation workers tells a powerful story.   For one group More than 122 @transportworker members died from COVID-19 a virus they almost certainly contracted while continuing to work in public as essential employees.

Pres. Trump's decision to terminate America's partnership with @WHO undermines our global fight against this pandemic. We must work more closely with the global community to save lives and develop vaccines not isolate ourselves from the cooperation needed to combat #COVID19.

More than 100000 of our fellow Americans have died of #COVID19. In addition that's countless grieving loved ones countless dreams dashed and countless life milestones missed. The grief is unimaginable but we must stay strong and continue to fight this virus in their honor. https://t.co/ZDPO0MhfAj

Tonight at 7:00 pm I’ll be participating in another @FOX59 live town hall focusing on #COVID19. I’m looking forward to answering your questions about the work that lies ahead to save lives and protect jobs. You can also stream it live at https://t.co/Y5dCfKQvOo. #IndianaTownHall

I want to give a big thanks to Dr. Anthony Fauci who participated in a call today with my colleagues and I in the @NewDemCoalition. He provided invaluable insight that will improve our efforts to help prevent the spread of #COVID19 and safely reopen our economy.

The House has passed the #HeroesAct another major #COVID19 relief bill that:  - Provides $75 billion for testing tracing & treatment  - Gives more support to frontline heroes  - Issues a 2nd round of direct payments to Americans  - Sends more help to small businesses  - & more.

Last night the House passed the #HeroesAct — our latest #COVID19 relief package to provide much-needed support to our frontline heroes and others harmed by the crisis in Indiana and across America. Lets put partisanship aside and make it law. Read more: https://t.co/WSjFO9aSyI
Don’t miss the @BlueAngels flyover today at 2pm — but be sure to socially distance while you watch this tribute to our frontline #COVID19 responders! https://t.co/V4S5tq7F2q
In my latest op-ed in the @IndyRecorder I write about #COVID19's devastating impact on Black America and how we must tackle this crisis more equitably. https://t.co/2YrFIsGvGX
A reminder: Please check the @IRSnews website regularly to find the latest guidance and instructions on how to receive your #COVID19 economic impact payments: https://t.co/1ixBSGSVJK
I am pleased to help lead this important effort. We need to do much more to protect our seniors from #COVID19 and that can't happen without more testing. https://t.co/Zq8G61H11R

The public health data is clear: It's simply too soon to safely begin reopening Indiana. @StateHealthIN shows a continued growth of #COVID19 infections. We have yet to #flattenthecurve. A premature reopening of public places could cost lives and lengthen this pandemic. https://t.co/7pSZlWx4gL

#COVID19 has made the health disparities that have long existed in America even more apparent. That’s why I continue working w/ @CAPAC @HispanicCaucus & @TheBlackCaucus during #MinorityHealthMonth to take on structural inequalities that contribute to these disparities. #NMHM2020

I'm pleased to announce that @INDairport and other local airports have received more than $50 million in additional funds through the #CARESAct. I'll keep working to help our aviation employees and all other workers harmed by the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/tckKwr3bjH

The #COVID19 crisis has sadly sparked an alarming rise in incidents of #domesticviolence. Now more than ever we must protect those at risk. That's why I'm honored to support @RepWexton's legislation to provide more resources for local law enforcement responding to these cases. https://t.co/3JWi2ZTGJE

#COVID19's devastation in communities of color in Southwest Georgia and the state's premature reopening are stark lessons for Indiana and the whole country. The virus does not discriminate and we must make sure our government's response doesn't either.  https://t.co/IPK5fcSyxe

My heart remains with the people of #Kashmir during this challenging time. The draconian restrictions placed upon them by PM Modi are not only taking away their basic human rights but also making it more difficult to protect against #COVID19. These unjust restrictions must end!

Pleased that Congress has come together to provide nearly $500 billion more dollars for small business owners hospitals and additional testing in our fight against #COVID19. I'll keep working hard to get even more help for Hoosiers who need it most. https://t.co/XbPPqIqaIV

Wishing a #RamadanMubarak to all of my fellow Muslims in Indiana across America and around the world who are celebrating #Ramadan! Though #COVID19 will keep many of us physically apart I have no doubt that this special season will unite our faith community more than ever. https://t.co/dynJ9ECuTE

As the #COVID19 crisis continues scammers are working overtime to steal your money and your sensitive personal information. Stay informed and stay vigilant. Visit https://t.co/qc3lSUIRXl for more details. https://t.co/w7BttVq3RY

I thank all my fellow Muslims who have been engaged in the effort to defeat #COVID19. Whether staying at home working on the front lines or volunteering in a number of ways our community has remained united to protect our family friends and neighbors. Let’s keep it up!

Happy #EarthDay! The current #COVID19 crisis has shown that we have to work together as a global community to keep people healthy. The same goes for keeping our planet healthy. Let's recommit ourselves to protecting our environment for all of us and for future generations. https://t.co/aC7LphMCG2

#ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving: Thank you for your hard work to help our country defeat #COVID19. From transit workers to truck drivers aviation employees & many more -- we simply could not get through this without you. We'll keep working to get you the support you need. @TransportDems https://t.co/6zZsgOK7Kk

President Trump claims the #COVID19 pandemic is improving and we can begin to reopen. Yet he also claims it’s so bad we must close our nation’s doors to all immigrants? His handling of this crisis isn’t based in logic. It’s based in his own reckless dangerous agenda.

ATTENTION: Recipients of Supplemental Security Income will automatically receive their $1200 #COVID19 Economic Impact Payments. No further action is needed on your part to receive this payment and you should receive it soon.

My colleagues and I are urging @SecAzar & @SeemaCMS to work w/ states localities and private labs to get more data about #COVID19 cases in nursing homes and long-term care facilities. This information can help us protect countless lives. Read our letter: https://t.co/VuYYSm3yoM

In case you missed it check out my full Instagram Live conversation with @RepJeffries yesterday on #COVID19 relief voting rights and more. And thanks to my friend and colleague for a great discussion! https://t.co/0CALkyfeEp

#COVID19 is a global crisis & we must work together as a global community to solve it. Pres. Trump's decision to cut funding for @WHO greatly jeopardizes our efforts to save lives. He should be more concerned with finding solutions than blaming others for his disastrous response.

ATTENTION: The IRS has created online tools to help ensure Americans receive their #Coronavirus Economic Impact Payments.   If you have filed taxes and are wondering when you'll receive your payment you can track it here:   https://t.co/zxDbgE2kzc

I'm compelled to sponsor this bill. More and more data is showing that people of color are disproportionately harmed by #COVID19. This isn't surprising but it's still unacceptable. We must act now to fight minority health disparities. https://t.co/kEmFEzAgXs
I'm participating in a town hall focusing on help for small businesses and entrepreneurs harmed by the #COVID19 pandemic. Watch live starting at 4:00 pm ET. @1067WTLC  https://t.co/uXyTGw51Xg

We all have a role to play in fighting fraud during the #COVID19 crisis. If you suspect fraudulent activity be sure to report it. It can help protect fellow Hoosiers and save lives. https://t.co/GBp6176B9x

Some good news in our fight against #COVID19: Indiana has been awarded $4.2 million from @CDCgov through the #CARESAct to help us slow the spread of the virus. This is a huge help and I’ll keep working to bring more federal dollars back to our state for these efforts!

BREAKING: @FEMA has approved IN's request for a disaster declaration. That means our state will now have additional resources & flexibility to respond boldly to the #COVID19 crisis. I'll continue working closely with state & local leaders to help get us through this challenge.

Another way the House’s #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act is helping Hoosiers in need. In times of crisis and in times of prosperity we must work to make sure nobody goes hungry. https://t.co/4dGEZRjT22

Today at 1:30 pm I’ll be talking with @tcosby18 on “Community Connection” about the #CARESAct and the work we must do to make it through this #COVID19 crisis. Click the link to listen live! https://t.co/2K2LdWhkRW

Happy #CesarChavezDay! As we battle #COVID19 the message of this iconic activist is clearer than ever: We’re nothing without our workers. This is particularly true for the farm workers who are risking their lives to keep Americans fed. We must do all we can to protect them. https://t.co/suT66cWvPG

Today is #EqualPayDay which represents how far into 2020 a woman must work to make as much money as a man makes in 2019 alone.  Women are in the front lines of the #COVID19 pandemic risking their lives for us all. All of them and all women deserve equal pay for equal work.

#ICYMI here's the full video of yesterday's Instagram Live Q&A on help for small businesses hurt by the #COVID19 crisis. Thanks to @SBAgov rep Marty Anderson for joining me. Additional contact info can be found in the video description. https://t.co/ABmAefw8Ku

Happy #NationalDoctorsDay to the hard-working doctors who are on the front lines of the #COVID19 pandemic. We can't thank you enough & we'll keep working to get you the resources you need. Give a shout-out to the doctors in your life & let them know how much you appreciate them!

Today I’m going live on Instagram at 3 pm ET with a local rep from @SBAgov. We’ll be answering your questions about help available to small businesses hurt by the #COVID19 crisis. I hope you’ll join us! https://t.co/eoEcAZVGa2

Today the House passed the #CARESAct -- a major bipartisan #COVID19 relief package that will help Americans get through this unprecedented crisis. We can't stop here though. Let's keep working to support Americans in need now & in the future. Read more: https://t.co/QR1nPG0LII https://t.co/oy19s9VyrX

Next Monday I'll be live on Instagram with a local rep from @SBAgov to answer your questions about assistance available to small business owners hurt by the #COVID19 crisis. Submit your Q's ahead of time by replying below or ask live. We'll do our best to answer them all! https://t.co/Zjh5c6F9Ui

#COVID19 is challenging our community and our nation but I believe we'll weather this storm thanks to countless Americans who have bravely stepped up. In my latest @IndyRecorder op-ed I'm outlining the ways America should be supporting these helpers.  https://t.co/M8I1QPBhHr

The House has introduced a third #COVID19 relief package called the "Take Responsibility for Workers and Families Act." This is our boldest and biggest effort yet investing trillions into the health and well-being of everyday Americans. Read more: https://t.co/5yWTusHpB1

Attention: Indiana's hotline to help business and industry comply with @GovHolcomb's #StayAtHome order is temporarily down. You can still contact the hotline with business/industry questions via email at covidresponse@iedc.in.gov or visit this FAQ page: https://t.co/f0fdeYDiY3

The student loan debt crisis is out of control and the economic devastation of #COVID19 makes that even clearer. That's why I have cosponsored the “Student Debt Emergency Relief Act" which cancels at least $30K in loan debt per borrower.
I applaud this bold but necessary move by @GovHolcomb. We have our best shot at lessening the severe impact of #COVID19 when we #StayAtHome as much as possible. https://t.co/BmR5RVO1pn

Today I was pleased to volunteer at @GleanersFBIndy. Food banks are playing a huge role in getting our communities through the #COVID19 crisis. I’ll keep working to make sure they have the support they need to support others! https://t.co/AthQu0S4dB

My Congressional colleagues and I have written to @BetsyDeVosED urging her to put plans in place to mitigate #COVID19's financial impact on higher ed students. School closures have raised many important questions and these students need answers. https://t.co/Oj1yzTMt4Y

Pleased to add my voice to this call for much-needed relief. To help #SlowTheSpread of #COVID19 House leaders are urging Americans to stay home. And that must also include Americans who are unable to pay the rent or mortgage during this unprecedented public health crisis. https://t.co/uDD0PqdCk6

America has the best military in the world and it has a major role to play in fighting #COVID19. My colleagues and I sent a letter to President Trump urging him to better utilize @DeptofDefense resources to #StopTheSpread of this virus. Read our letter:  https://t.co/sn23TPEqax

#317Day is an occasion to celebrate our amazing city and the folks who make it great. This year as we all work to slow the spread of #COVID19 I'm giving a special shout out to Hoosiers on the front lines who keep our community safe and healthy -- today and every day. Thank you! https://t.co/9AgGxdxxo9

Tonight I participated in a call with @GovHolcomb and my fellow Hoosiers in elected office about all that our state is doing to respond to the #COVID19 outbreak and how we can improve those efforts even more.

My deepest sympathies are with the loved ones of this member of our community who has died from #COVID19. We all have a role to play in preventing future loss of life. Stay home stay informed and heed the advice of public health officials. Together we will overcome this. https://t.co/dTirObdfJ7
Please note that many of these exhibitors may also be closed or have reduced hours in an effort to slow the spread of #COVID19.

Though I’m unfortunately no longer hosting my Youth Opportunities Fair this year due to concerns over #COVID19 I’m pleased to connect you via my website to the exhibitors who had planned to attend. Click the link for a full list and their contact info. https://t.co/AlsBhzhEZv
My statement on the passage of the bipartisan #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act: https://t.co/6xVPWKYo7w

#COVID19 threatens us all. That's why we must make #COVID19 testing free to all.   @HouseDemocrats’ #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act achieves that goal which will help America weather this pandemic. We can't wait another moment to make it law.   Lives are at stake. https://t.co/Nb4OoW4kLQ
In an effort to protect my constituents from the spread of #COVID19 I am cancelling my upcoming Youth Opportunities Fair.

Instead of downplaying #COVID19 to protect his Wall Street buddies President Trump should be supporting legislation to guarantee that all employees have paid sick leave. Nobody should be forced to make the choice between getting sick and paying the bills.
If you are experiencing symptoms of #COVID19 and believe you might be positive contact @StateHealthIN immediately for guidance and next steps.

BREAKING: An Indiana resident has tested presumptive-positive for the #COVID19 coronavirus. The state believes this is an isolated case. I’ll continue working closely with state and local officials to ensure we have the resources needed to take on this public health challenge.

This bipartisan effort is a good step toward fighting #COVID19 at home and abroad but it's only a start. We need to improve our entire public health infrastructure and protect Americans' health care to better handle crises like the one we're currently facing.

The House just passed an emergency $8.3 billion funding package to fight the #COVID19 #Coronavirus. This robust bill includes:  - $2.2 billion to @CDCgov   - More than $3 billion for research into a vaccine  - $300 million in aid to other countries battling the virus  and more.

The Trump Administration's response to #COVID19 (#Coronavirus) has been chaotic & inadequate which puts American lives at risk. My fellow @HouseDemocrats & I sent the President a letter demanding changes to properly address the crisis. Read our letter: https://t.co/hnuJCiFj02

I’m continuing to closely monitor the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus) here in the U.S. We should all remain calm but vigilant. For most this virus is not fatal and basic hygiene practices go far in preventing it. Get the latest info by visiting https://t.co/CMywWLraAw. https://t.co/GbP0Va9JnQ

Meanwhile the President claims the virus is "under control" while also planning to cut @CDCgov's budget by nearly 20%.  This administration is dangerously unprepared to handle a potential #CoronavirusOutbreak and the American people will pay the price. https://t.co/QLVrdhEqRZ
